item.title: PPC Executive
item.description:
Are you experienced in PPC and GoogleAds Manager? Are you looking to join a market-leading company? We have an exciting opportunity for a PPC Executive to join our award winning Marketing team based in Colwick, Nottingham. This role is hybrid, with three days working from our offices and two working from home.

Hillarys are part of the Hunter Douglas group of companies, the global market leader in window dressings so you’ll be working across international brands across the UK, Europe and Australia. You’ll be managing the in-house PPC accounts, implementing our PPC strategy and planning and optimising performance through platforms such as GoogleAds, SA360 and Bing, so experience across these is essential. You’ll have great relationship building skills to work closely with our digital agencies and international teams, and be a confident collaborator working alongside other teams within Marketing such as SEO, Social Media, Web, Data and more.

This role is a brilliant opportunity to gain exposure across international markets and continuously drive improvements and learnings across PPC for multiple brands. You’ll have a commercial understanding, and be confident with numbers and data analysis, with a keen eye for detail, as you’ll have ownership of PPC reporting. You don’t need to have a degree, but you’ll need to have vast PPC experience to add real value to the team.

Why should you consider this role? Here are just a few reasons:

  1. Make an impact: Take on a key role in our dynamic and results-orientated digital team, and have a lasting impact on our stakeholders by establishing effective working relationships.
  2. Think for the future: Contribute to driving our international brands forward through sharing best practice and managing their PPC accounts.
  3. Career progression: Grow your career in digital marketing, by joining a market-leading organisation, renowned for its commitment to innovation and excellence. We excel in nurturing the career development of those who join us and are passionate about what they do.

You’ll be joining an experienced and sociable team, where you’ll get the chance to flourish and develop. You’ll receive a wide range of benefits, including generous colleague discount for you (and family and friends!), a healthcare and lifestyle benefits package and a wide range of wellbeing initiatives.

We understand that there is no ‘one size fits all’ approach, and with this in mind, we are dedicated to providing an inclusive workplace where every colleague feels valued and comfortable to be their true self. If you require any reasonable adjustments throughout the recruitment process, please do let us know and we will be happy to accommodate.

Please note, the recruitment process for this will consist of two stages of interviews, which will include a task and presentation.

Everyone who applies will receive a response.

item.title: Digital PR Executive
item.description:
Are you an ambitious, forward-thinking individual who has a passion for continuous development? Are you ready to take the next step in your career? If so, we want to hear from you! An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Digital PR Executive to join our PR team based in Colwick, Nottingham. The successful candidate will start as soon as possible. 

This is a hybrid role, with three days in the office and two days working from home.

Hillarys are part of the Hunter Douglas group of companies, so this role provides opportunities to work across multiple brands under the group. You will work closely with different teams across our Marketing function, including the SEO, Design, and Brand teams, so good relationship building skills are essential. 

Reporting to the Digital PR Manager, the right person will have at least one years’ experience in Digital PR while also having a strong knowledge of its role in SEO. 

As a Digital PR Executive, here is an idea of what you will be doing: 

  • Planning and implementing Digital PR Campaigns from concept to outreach.  
  • Keeping up to date with industry market trends to fuel campaign development. 
  • Maintaining and updating media lists and reports. 
  • Maximising link building activity across our brands. 
  • Identifying and developing effective working relationships with key media contacts for suitable niches/ sectors. 
  • Drafting editorial copy, including press releases, features and by-lines. 

Are you the ideal candidate? We’re looking for someone who… 

  • Has proven and demonstrable results launching creative campaigns and reactive PR to secure coverage and links. 
  • Is passionate about Digital PR, loves to learn, and stays up to date with the industry. 
  • Has strong time-management skills, adept at efficiently and proactively meeting deadlines with excellent attention to detail. 
  • Has experience in leading ideations.
  • Is proficient in the use of outreach and media database tools. 
  • Has experience in dealing with short-lead reactive opportunities through the likes of ResponseSource and/or #JournoRequest.
  • The ability to work independently and take initiative. 
  • Is an effective team player with a collaborative mindset. 
  • Is proactive in voicing ideas and suggesting improvements when necessary. 
  • Is susceptible to change when circumstances dictate. 
  • Has excellent written and verbal communication skills  
  • Is open-minded, creative and proficient in idea generation. 
  • Ideally, has 1-2 years' experience in Digital PR (agency or in-house) 
  • Has experience working in Home Interiors desirable but not essential. 

Why should you consider this role? Here are just a few reasons: 

  1. Make an impact: Take on a key role in our dynamic and results-orientated PR team, and have a lasting impact on our stakeholders by establishing effective working relationships. 
  1. Think for the future: Contribute to driving our brands forward with new ideas and initiatives. 
  1. Career progression: Grow your career in PR, by joining a market-leading organisation, renowned for its commitment to innovation and excellence. We excel in nurturing the career development of those who join us and are passionate about what they do. 

When you join us, you will receive a wide range of benefits, including generous colleague discount for you, your family and friends, a healthcare and lifestyle benefits package, a wide range of wellbeing initiatives, and a fantastic office environment! 

We understand that there is no ‘one size fits all’ approach, and with this in mind, we are dedicated to providing an inclusive workplace where every colleague feels valued and comfortable to be their true self. If you require any reasonable adjustments throughout the recruitment process, please let us know and we will be happy to accommodate. 

Please note, all successful applicants will be required to complete two short online assessments and a pre-interview task as part of the recruitment process. 

Everyone who applies will receive a response.

item.title: Digital Marketing Executive
item.description:
Digital Marketing Executive

Are you looking to take your Digital Marketing experience to the next step? Do you like to push forward new ideas and make a difference to give customers the best digital experience possible?

If you’ve got experience in optimising and updating websites and are looking for your next opportunity to join a dynamic and award-winning marketing team that are at the forefront of the business, our Digital Marketing Executive role could be for you. Hillarys are part of the Hunter Douglas group of companies, so whilst this role will predominately manage and optimise the Hillarys website, there will be opportunities to work on other websites within the HD group.

Our websites are our key assets; with more than 95% of all customers landing here at some point in the customer journey, so you’ll need to champion customer experience throughout every aspect of this role and have a keen interest in the data side of our websites. You will take the lead in delivering our CRO programme, ensuring we are always optimising our websites through A/B testing, whilst sharing these learnings across the group and maintaining our position as market leader.

Attention to detail, organisation and prioritisation skills are a must, as you’ll be juggling multiple tasks at once. We’re looking for a self-starter who takes ownership of their decisions and work, delivering new ideas with tangible benefits, you’ll be great at communicating with various stakeholders from around the business. You’ll create detailed digital briefs that you see through to completion, effectively communicating with various business stakeholders and external agencies to keep them up-to-date and ensuring no detail is missed.

You’ll be great at balancing working autonomously and within a team, as you’ll be working on a breadth of exciting projects, whilst collaborating with other marketing functions such as SEO, Content, Insights, Social, Email and Campaign team to ensure the best user experience that drives real value for the business.

Are you the ideal candidate? Here’s what we’re looking for…

  • Experience in Digital Marketing – specifically working on websites and user experience.
  • Experience in A/B testing and CRO
  • Analytical, with the ability to interpret website data and performance via Google Analytics
  • Adopts a commercial mindset – ability to interpret business insights to make decisions and optimise our websites to drive the best quality leads into the business.
  • Confident communicator and excellent collaborator
  • Strong prioritisation skills
  • Ability to use initiative, with the ability to identify opportunities to enhance customer experience.
  • Adaptable to change
  • Good presentation skills

You’ll receive many benefits, such as discounted gym memberships, generous staff discount (including family and friends!), healthcare and lifestyle benefits packages, and a fantastic working environment. This role is hybrid, with two days working from home and three days working from our office in Nottingham.

We understand that there is no ‘one size fits all’ approach, and with this in mind, we are dedicated to providing an inclusive workplace where every colleague feels valued and comfortable to be their true self. If you require any reasonable adjustments throughout the recruitment process, please do let us know and we will be happy to accommodate.

The recruitment process will consist of two stages of interviews. Everyone who applies will receive a response.

Everyone who applies will receive a response.

item.title: Customer Care Professionals
item.description:
Do you have strong experience in a customer focused role within retail or contact centre? We’re looking for 9 customer care professionals to join our vibrant Contact Centre team, based at our Nottingham Head Office, as a Customer Care Professional.

You’ll need to be an enthusiastic and driven team player with experience as a customer service professional, as you’ll be dealing with incoming and outbound enquiries and complaints, via telephone and email, from customers and our self-employed advisor network.

As a Customer Care Professional you’ll need great communication skills, as you’ll be liaising with internal departments to investigate and resolve customer order issues, and with our field based team to organise service calls to customer homes. Decision making is an important aspect of this role, as you’ll be negotiating discounts in line with company guidelines, and must be able to handle complaints appropriately, whilst remaining professional and respectful at all times.

Personal development is a key part of what we do here, so you’ll need to take ownership of your own personal development plan, in addition to being part of a dynamic team.

Customer Care Professional key responsibilities

  • Objection / complaint handling in a professional and respectful manner at all times
  • Liaising with internal departments to investigate and resolve customer order issues through to a satisfactory conclusion
  • Liaising with field based Advisors, Design Consultants, Installers and the Field Management Teams to organise service calls to customers properties
  • Working with third parties to organise customer repairs.
  • Organising a number of different parties to ensure this is completed within the agreed timescale. 
  • Negotiate discounts with customers in line with company guidelines
  • Process compensation, credits and discounts
  • Taking payments in line with PCI compliance
  • We love new ideas here at Hillarys – Our Hillarys Ideas Programme will inspire you to identify and generate fresh ideas to delight our customers and our team

Successful candidates can look forward to joining a lively and friendly team with a fun but fast paced working environment, where you can have a bright career, and enjoy a fantastic range of benefits. These include free car parking, a health care and lifestyle benefits package, and generous staff discount.

The rate of pay for this role is £13 per hour working 37.5 hours per week, working Monday to Friday, 9am to 5pm. Experience in a customer service role is essential in order for you to hit the ground running.

We understand that there is no ‘one size fits all’ approach, and with this in mind, we are dedicated to providing an inclusive workplace where every colleague feels valued and comfortable to be their true self. If you require any reasonable adjustments throughout the recruitment process, please do let us know and we will be happy to accommodate

Everyone who applies will receive a response.
